page.title: 18ODDINGLEY:NETHERWOOD FARM.
page.content: This 17th century farm is set between two woods,neither of which belong to the farm.Therefore it's name became {Netherwood.}The farm is 120 acres,of which 90 acres are grassland (52 acres of this being cut for hay) and 30 acres barley.In the summer this produces 7000 bales of hay and 2000 bales of straw.The main product is milk. Most of this milk is sold to local dairies.However the family process some of the milk to produce cheese, cream and yoghurt which they eat themselves and sell to friends.They also have a small number of turkeys which they fatten and sell locally at Christmas.In 1806{Richard {Hemmings}dead body(see page 14 ) was dragged through a hedge and made a gap which to this day has never grown back.
